title: Language Proficiency Improvement Program Using Peer Assessment Design and Classification Systems

context.prior_knowledge: Knowledge of basic language assessment methodologies and principles of peer evaluation
context.additional_context: Focuses on designing peer assessment systems using digital environments and cultivating practical application skills.

learning_goals: Learners can explain five clusters of peer assessment (assessment purpose, evaluation criteria, feedback types, process structuring, technical support).
Learners can design and apply a peer assessment classification system (20 variables) tailored to language learning contexts.
Learners can implement peer assessment processes using digital tools and analyze summative assessment results.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
